meanings.definition: Unpleasant or offensive in smell or taste.
meanings.sent1: The skanky odor from the garbage made me wrinkle my nose.
meanings.sent2: The skanky cheese left a bad taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't eat the skanky soup without feeling queasy.
meanings.sent4: The skanky smell in the room was like a cloud of stench.
meanings.sent5: The skanky fish market was a sensory assault on my nostrils.

meanings.definition: Dirty, unkempt, or disreputable in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She refused to wear the skanky old clothes to the party.
meanings.sent2: The skanky alley was littered with trash and debris.
meanings.sent3: The skanky old sofa looked like it had seen better days.
meanings.sent4: His skanky appearance made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The skanky street was a sad sight with its rundown buildings.

meanings.sent1: The skanky behavior of the characters shocked the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her skanky relationships with different partners.
meanings.sent3: The skanky gossip about their love lives was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: His skanky reputation preceded him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The skanky affairs in the soap opera kept viewers hooked for weeks.
